articles.title: Church puzzled by reports of Abe assassination suspect's alleged grudge
articles.description: The man suspected of assassinating Shinzo Abe targeted the former Japanese Prime Minister because he believed Abe's grandfather -- another former leader of the country -- had helped the expansion of a religious group he held a grudge against, according to pub…

articles.title: Exclusive: Former Overstock CEO Patrick Byrne to meet with January 6 investigators
articles.description: Former Overstock CEO Patrick Byrne, an ally of former President Donald Trump, is expected to meet Friday with the House select committee investigating January 6, 2021, according to three sources familiar with the matter.

articles.title: Watch: Shinzo Abe murder suspect had 'grudge' against church, police say - CNN Video
articles.description: According to police, the suspect accused of assassinating former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe had a "grudge" against a church he believed Abe had ties with. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

articles.title: Who is Akie Abe? The widow of assassinated Japanese leader Shinzo Abe
articles.description: When Akie Matsuzaki married a rising political aide by the name of Shinzo Abe in 1987, she followed a path well trodden by Japanese wives and gave up her job at the country's largest advertising agency.

articles.title: Live updates: Shinzo Abe funeral in Japan
articles.description: The funeral of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is taking place today in Tokyo, following his assassination last Friday in the city of Nara.
articles.content:
Police in Japan are continuing to investigate Shinzo Abe's assassination following the arrest of suspect Tetsuya Yamagami at the scene moments after the fatal shooting last Friday.

articles.author: Helen Regan, Emiko Jozuka and Mayumi Maruyama, CNN
articles.title: What we know about the man suspected of shooting Shinzo Abe
articles.description: Police in Japan have launched a murder investigation into the assassination of former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe -- but little is known about the suspect who was arrested at the scene of the fatal shooting on Friday.

articles.title: Photos: Shock and grief as world reacts to Abe shooting
articles.description: Following the death of Shinzo Abe, many people around the world have been paying tribute to the former Japanese prime minister and offering their condolences.
articles.content:
People lay flowers at Zojoji Temple, where the vigil and funeral of late former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, will be held in Tokyo, Japan, on July 11.
Updated 12:48 PM ET, Mon July 11, 2022

articles.author: Ashley Strickland, CNN
articles.title: President Biden will share the Webb Telescope's first image today
articles.description: President Joe Biden will share the first image from the James Webb Space Telescope on Monday at the White House at 5 p.m. ET. The rest of Webb's first images will be released on Tuesday.
